CatDescriptText: Sidney Blum, general office worker, Squirrel Hill and Agnes Traylor, housewife, Lawrenceville, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, July 23, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "What do you think is the number one problem for city officials to solve in the redevelopment program?  Why?"  Mr. Blum's answer reads: "The biggest problem, which should be attacked, is high taxes.  I say lower those taxes and bring wages up, because the cost of living is too high."  Mrs. Traylor's answer reads: "As to which is the number one problem, it is extremely hard to say, because it seems to me that everything is needed to be done."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Sidney Blum wearing light colored suit jacket, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown; Portrait of Agnes Traylor wearing gingham dress, standing in front of Empire Building, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
